definition: an act of dismissal from employment or an office
examples: Days before the sacking, the trio drew up a list of candidate-heirs.
Is it any wonder that so many nanny jobs end in blowups and abrupt sackings?

definition: an act or action of plundering or vanquishing
examples: One society leader compared the sight to the sacking of Versailles.

definition: material for sacks, a coarse fabric (such as burlap)
